subject: Real Estate
title: Macroprudential Tools
description: Learn Macroprudential Tools in one minute.

hook.text: After 2008, regulators invented new tools to cool housing markets before they overheat.

buildup.text: Loan-to-value caps limit how much buyers can borrow. Debt-to-income rules limit monthly payments.

discovery.text: These macroprudential tools let regulators target housing directly, without raising rates for the whole economy.

twist.text: New Zealand and Canada used them aggressively â€” with mixed results. Buyers simply found workarounds.

climax.text: Macroprudential tools are smarter than blunt rate hikes, but no regulation can fully contain human greed.

punchline.text: Smarter rules slow bubbles. They can't stop them.

quiz.question: What are macroprudential tools designed to do?
options: Cool housing markets before they overheat
